subsubsection.p:
Look up the definitions of new terms in the Glossary.
Compounding period

li.p: We can use the properties of logarithms to solve exponential equations with any base.
The amount in an account earning interest compounded n times per year is an exponential function of time.
The properties of logs are really another form of which familiar laws?
Which log property allows us to solve an exponential equation whose base is not 10?
Explain why 12\cdot 10^{3x} is not the same as 120^{3x}.
Which of the following expressions are equivalent? \log\left(\dfrac{x}{4} \right) ~~~~~ \dfrac{\log x}{\log 4} ~~~~~~~ \log(x-4) ~~~ \log x - \log 4
Which of the following expressions are equivalent? \log(x+2) ~~~~~ \log x+\log 2 ~~~~~ \log(2x) ~~~~~ (\log 2) (\log x)
Which of the following expressions are equivalent? \log x^3 ~~~~~(\log 3)(\log x) ~~~~~ 3\log x ~~~~~ \log 3^x
